title: US Congress approves release of Epstein files
byline: The Republican-controlled U.S. Congress voted almost unanimously on Tuesday to force the release of Justice Department files on the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, an outcome President Donald Trump had fought for months before ending his opposition.

title: Train services along Upcountry Line restricted to Nanu Oya due to derailment
byline: Train services along the Upcountry Line have been limited to the Nanu Oya railway station, the Department of Railways said.

title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in Northern, North-central and Eastern provinces.

title: Education holds power to unite people politically, socially and economically – PM Harini
byline: Education is a process of sharing collective knowledge and has the power to bring people together politically, socially and economically, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated.

title: Budget 2026: Expenditure heads of Ministries of Public Administration and Labour to be debated today
byline: The expenditure heads of the Ministry of Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government and the Ministry of Labour are scheduled to be debated in Parliament today (19).

title: Mobile users levied 20.3% tax on data, 38% on voice calls, TRC confirms
byline: Mobile phone users are required to pay a 20.3% tax on internet services and a 38% tax on regular voice calls, the Telecommunications Regulatory Commission (TRC) has stated.

title: Disney unveils 1st teaser for live-action ‘Moana,’ sailing into theaters next year
byline: Disney has released the first teaser trailer for the upcoming live-action remake of the animated film “Moana.”

title: Three SriLankan Airlines flights diverted
byline: Three international flights scheduled to land at the Bandaranaike International Airport this morning have been diverted due to dense fog that significantly reduced visibility.

title: ‘Parasocial’ named Cambridge dictionary word of the year
byline: The Cambridge Dictionary has revealed “parasocial” as its word of the year for 2025, defined as involving a connection someone feels between themselves and a famous person they do not know.

title: Fire breaks out at factory in Ranala
byline: A fire has broken out in a storage facility of a factory in Ranala, Kaduwela early this morning (19), police stated.

title: Deputy FM Arun Hemachandra to attend EU-Indo Pacific Ministerial Forum in Belgium
byline: The Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs and Foreign Employment, Arun Hemachandra is scheduled to leave for Belgium today (19), to attend the Fourth EU-Indo Pacific Ministerial Forum.

title: Chikungunya spreading rapidly in Matara: Entomology officers
byline: The chikungunya disease is spreading rapidly in the Matara district, the Health Entomology Officers’ Association has warned.

title: Ronaldo attends White House meeting between Trump and Saudi crown prince
byline: Portugal’s soccer star Cristiano Ronaldo on Tuesday attended a White House meeting between U.S. President Donald Trump and Saudi Arabia’s Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman.

title: Sri Lanka’s manufacturing and services sectors expand in October
byline: Sri Lanka’s Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI) for October 2025 recorded growth in both manufacturing and services sectors.

title: Major Green Card change proposed: No PR if immigrants likely to become dependent on govt
byline: The Trump administration on Monday proposed giving immigration officers authority to deny permanent residency to lawfully present immigrants who use Medicaid or other food and housing assistance programs, arguing that “government benefits should not incentivize immigration” and that immigrants should be “self-reliant.”

title: Individual nabbed for plotting to murder hotel owner in Weligama
byline: An individual who visited a tourist hotel in Weligama allegedly to murder the owner of the premises has been arrested, police stated.

title: Australian PM says no apology over Border Force’s secret boat returnee scheme
byline: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has dismissed concerns a secret operation using fishing boats to remove people from Australia’s northern waters is subsidising illegal fishers and people smugglers.

title: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum rejects Trump’s offer of military intervention against cartels
byline: Mexico’s president on Tuesday ruled out allowing U.S. strikes against cartels on Mexican soil, a day after U.S. President Donald Trump said he was willing to do whatever it takes to stop drugs entering the U.S.

title: Upcountry train derailment occurred at previously identified hazardous site – Minister
byline: Minister of Transport Bimal Ratnayake stated today (19) in Parliament that the location where a Colombo-bound train derailed along the upcountry line had previously been identified as a hazardous area.

title: Committee appointed to investigate conduct of Dayasiri Jayasekara in Parliament
byline: A three-member committee has been appointed to investigate a complaint made by Deputy Minister Sunil Watagala regarding the conduct of Parliamentarian Dayasiri Jayasekara.

title: Shortage of medicinal plants has affected Ayurvedic medicine production: Experts
byline: The Sri Lanka Ayurvedic Drugs Corporation states that it is facing a severe crisis due to the shortage of medicinal plants required for the production of local Ayurvedic medicines.

title: Court sets December 16 hearing on Trincomalee temple dispute
byline: The Court of Appeal today (19) scheduled a hearing on December 16 to consider a petition seeking an injunction to prevent the implementation of an order issued by the Department of Coastal Conservation to remove a part of the Trincomalee Sri Sambuddha Jayanthi Bodhiraja Viharaya.

title: Government to introduce new fisherman’s pension scheme
byline: The government has announced plans to introduce a new Fisherman’s Pension Scheme, effective from December 21, 2025.

title: ITAK MPs meet President for talks
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has held a special discussion with several parliamentarians and representatives of the Illankai Tamil Arasu Kadchi (ITAK).

title: Sri Lanka strengthens engagement with European Parliament on GSP+ and trade cooperation
byline: Sri Lanka’s Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs and Foreign Employment, Arun Hemachandra, has held a constructive meeting in Brussels, Belgium this afternoon with Bernd Lange, Member of the European Parliament, Chair of the International Trade Committee (INTA), and EU GSP+ Rapporteur.

title: China bans Japanese seafood as diplomatic dispute deepens
byline: China informed Japan on Wednesday that it will ban all imports of Japanese seafood, media outlets reported - a decision which comes amid an escalating diplomatic dispute between Asia’s top two economies.

title: Namal Rajapaksa rejects reports circulating about his degree certificates
byline: Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa has rejected the reports currently being circulated regarding his degree and education qualifications.

title: Fire burning in southwestern Japan damages 170 homes and forces evacuations
byline: Firefighters and army helicopters battled a fire Wednesday that burned through a neighborhood in southwestern Japan, killing one person, injuring another and forcing more than 170 people to evacuate.

title: India to host Colombo Security Conclave NSA meeting tomorrow
byline: The Seventh Meeting of the National Security Advisors (NSAs) of the Colombo Security Conclave (CSC) will be held in New Delhi tomorrow (20), the Indian Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has announced.

title: Appeals Court orders report on measures to prevent human–elephant conflict
byline: The Court of Appeal today directed the Minister of Wildlife and several other respondents to submit a report detailing the measures taken by the government to prevent human–elephant conflict.

title: Two arrested over foreign employment scams
byline: Authorities have arrested two individuals in connection with large-scale foreign employment scams, the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) stated.

title: Proposal seeking select committee to probe release of 323 containers presented to parliament
byline: A proposal seeking the appointment of a Parliamentary Select Committee to look into the release of 323 containers without mandatory physical inspection and to report to Parliament was presented to Parliament today.

title: Committee appointed to draft service constitution for specialist doctors
byline: Steps have been taken by the Ministry of Health to appoint a committee to draft the service constitution for specialist doctors.

title: Two night mail trains cancelled today
byline: Sri Lanka Railways announced that two night mail trains operating between Colombo Fort and Badulla railway stations will be cancelled today (19).

title: Miss Universe judge quits scandal-ridden pageant
byline: Two Miss Universe judges have resigned days before the annual beauty pageant, with one of them accusing organisers of rigging the selection process.

title: All parties must work together to counter attempts to create ethnic tensions – President tells TNA MPs
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake says he held a meeting with a delegation of Members of Parliament from the Tamil National Alliance (TNA), this afternoon (19) at the Presidential Secretariat following a request made by the party.

title: CBSL issues notice to public on prohibited pyramid schemes
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has issued a notice to the public regarding prohibited pyramid schemes.

title: Low pressure area likely to intensify and near Sri Lanka’s northern coast
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that a fresh low pressure area is likely to form over southeast Bay of Bengal around Saturday (November 22).
